summary: In November 2009, an Army officer shot 45 people at Fort Hood, Texas. Four years later, a Navy contractor shot 16 people at the Navy Yard in Washington, D.C. DOD increasingly uses physical access control systems to screen people who want to enter military installations. The systems scan credentials and check them against FBI and other government databases. However, we found that DOD didn't know...
title: DOD Installations: Monitoring Use of Physical Access Control Systems Could Reduce Risks to Personnel and Assets
